title: Tottenham receive Giovani Lo Celso and Ryan Sessegnon injury boost

Tottenham have received a boost after Giovani Lo Celso and Ryan Sessegnon returned to training.

However, Saturday's clash against Watford may come too soon for the two as Tottenham bid to steer their season back on course.

Spurs host Watford on Saturday desperate for a win after a shock 3-0 defeat to Brighton before the international break left them languishing in ninth place in the Premier League - 13 points behind leader Liverpool .

The Brighton loss followed a 7-2 mauling at home to Bayern Munich in the Champions League, with both results piling the pressure on Tottenham boss Mauricio Pochettino.

So the return of the two summer signings will be a boost to Pochettino as he plots a way to return to the form that saw Tottenham reach last season's Champions League final and put pressure on top two Manchester City and Liverpool for parts of last term.

(Image: AFP/Getty Images)

Midfielder Lo Celso has made just three substitute appearances after joining on loan from Real Betis in the summer, and suffered a hip problem on international duty with Argentina last month.

Winger Sessegnon has yet to feature for Spurs as he was carrying a hamstring injury when he joined from Fulham .

Tottenham are being patient with his recovery after he suffered a setback following a return to training last month.

Spurs hope Sessegnon will be in contention to make his long-awaited debut by the start of next month, according to Mail Online .

(Image: EMPICS Sport)

The 19-year-old has been pencilled in for Under 23 duty.

The Mail reports that Juan Foyth could fill Spurs's problem right-back position against Watford on Saturday.

Foyth has yet to play for Spurs this campaign after suffering an ankle injury in pre-season.

Following Kieran Trippier's departure to Atletico Madrid in the summer, Pochettino has used four different players at right back.

Serge Aurier, Kyle Walker-Peters, Davinson Sanchez and Moussa Sissoko have all played there, with the latter two both playing out of position.
description: Pair ready to kick-start their seasons after injury but Watford clash may be too soon
